name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

key_work.title: Sergei Eisenstein
key_work.brief_description: Sergei Eisenstein was a Soviet director and film theorist who pioneered the use of montage and changed how we see cinema. Eisenstein believed that juxtaposing different film shots created meaning, manipulated emotions and communicated ideas through visual metaphors.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_primary.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

start.title: Astro Boy
start.brief_description: In the year 2000, Dr. Boyton creates a super-robot in his deceased son’s image. He calls the robot Astro Boy. Astro Boy can swim oceans, leap over mountains, even fly into space on his own power. However, Astro Boy can’t replace his son.

constellations_other.name: Distributed Consciousness
constellations_other.description: Distributed Consciousness mixes NFT technology and custom AI software created by the artist to question artificial intelligence, ecology, sustainability, consciousness and free will - just like the works in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

end.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
end.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

links.description: Astro Boy‘s graphic simplicity appealed to Stanley Kubrick when he was in the process of developing 2001: A Space Odyssey. He asked Tezuka to manage the art direction but Tezuka refused due to his many pre-existing commitments.

end.title: Disaster Playground
end.brief_description: Disaster Playground investigates future outer space catastrophes and the procedures to manage and assess the risks. The film follows the scientists planning the monitoring and deflection of hazardous Near Earth Objects.

end.title: Metal Gear Solid
end.brief_description: A third-person story-heavy stealth action title which follows Solid Snake, a special operations soldier, who infiltrates a nuclear weapons facility by the name of Shadow Moses Island to neutralize a renegade special forces unit named FOXHOUND. Throughout his journey, he uncovers various lies and military conspiracies, and his ideas of trust, violence and control are challenged.

links.description: Videogame designer Hideo Kojima’s love of cinema influences the design and detail of his games. Metal Gear Solid contains references to his favourite film 2001: A Space Odyssey including character names: Hal Emmerich and Solid Snake’s real name, David.

end.title: Battleship Potemkin
end.brief_description: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resultant public demonstration, showing support, which brought on a police massacre. The film had an incredible impact on the development of cinema and is a masterful example of montage editing.

links.description: This Soviet director and film theorist pioneered the use of montage, believing that juxtaposing different film shots created meaning and communicated ideas through visual metaphors. His second film, Battleship Potemkin, was made up of over 1,300 shots.

end.title: Three Little Pigs
end.brief_description: The two pigs building houses of hay and sticks scoff at their brother, building the brick house. But when the wolf comes around and blows their houses down (after trickery like dressing as a foundling sheep fails), they run to their brother’s house. And throughout, they sing the classic song, “Who’s Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?”.

links.description: Always actively engaged with innovation in moving image storytelling, Eisenstein admired the fluidity of movement that characterised Disney animation and the imaginative freedom it offered American audiences living in an oppressive capitalist society.
